John Terry has revealed why he will be missing Chelsea's away Premier League clash against Burnley on Sunday - and it's very gruesome. 
The Blues captain posted a video of himself receiving stitches after picking up a nasty training ground injury. 
It's a horrible looking wound on the 36-year-old's ankle and judging by the stitches needed it's a painful one, too. 
Terry has only made five Premier League appearances so far this season, and recently admitted in an interview with Steven Gerrard he would be happy to spend the rest of the season on the bench if it meant Chelsea win the league. Terry's gruesome injury (Photo: John Terry / Instagram) 
But the club captain probably didn't envisage being out of action under these circumstances. 
Chelsea head into Sunday's fixture nine points ahead of second placed Spurs - but face a stern test against Burnley who have a very strong home record. poll loading Will John Terry leave Chelsea in the summer? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
